bmc_health_check(last_reboot=None)[source]¶

This method is to check if all the required daemons like healthd, fscd, sensord are running and started atleast2 mins ago. This check for services if they started 2 mins ago is to makesure the daemons have started and collected the required information atleast one time and out havoc tests doesnt fails sensord non-reporting errors

get_config(log_dir, test_start_time, start=True, bios_dump_filter=None)[source]¶

Retrieves all configuration data about this OpenBMC system and returns it in a dictionary.

@param log_dir: Will store logfile contents in this directory @param Float test_start_time: epoch time when test begins @param start: Indicates whether this is the start or the end of the test @param cfg_filter: object that contains config check filters @return {}: dictionary with config check info

parse_ecc_errors(log)[source]¶

Check ecc value for checking openbmc current health Report any correctable or uncorrectable error logged on the BMC as Failure. This check will let us monitor the correctable uncorrectable errors

@param {} log: contains correctable ECC and uncorrectable ECC

OpenBMCGlacierPointV2 Module¶

class havoc.autoval.lib.host.models.openbmc_glacierpointv2.OpenBMCGlacierPointV2(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: havoc.autoval.lib.host.models.openbmc_yosemitev2.OpenBMCYosemiteV2

Sideband methods to execute on GPV2 server.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

device_fru_list()[source]¶

execute fruid-util command on all the 12 pcie devices on gpv2 returns fruid from all devices

fw_update_glacierpoint_bic(bmc_binary_file_path)[source]¶

This function performs bic fw-update of the gpv2 switch slot Return value of this function is the console output of fw-update command

fw_update_glacierpoint_bicbl(bmc_binary_file_path)[source]¶

This function performs bicbl fw-update of the gpv2 switch slot Return value of this function is the console output of fw-update command

fw_update_glacierpoint_cpld(bmc_binary_file_path)[source]¶

Executes the cpld fw update for GPv2 switch slot Executes the ac_cycle(gpv2 slot)

fw_update_pcie_switch(bmc_binary_file_path)[source]¶

Executes the pcie_sw fw update for GPv2 switch slot

get_cpld_glacierpoint_fw_version()[source]¶

Retrieves the GPv2 slot CPLD Version

get_full_fruid_list()[source]¶
Extract and return

all the YV2 server related fruid + GPV2 switch fruid + 12 devices fruid

get_fw_util_options()[source]¶

Return YV2 related fw-util + GPv2 slot fw-util

get_glacierpoint_bic_version()[source]¶

Retrieves the GPv2 slot Bridge-IC Version

get_glacierpoint_bicbl_version()[source]¶

Retrieves the GPv2 slot Bridge-IC Bootloader Version

get_pciesw_fw_version()[source]¶

Retrieves the GPv2 slot pcie_sw Version

get_slot_for_gpv2()[source]¶

Glacier PointV2 is attached to a twinlake yosemitev2 host. The pairs are: Slot2 host -> Slot1 GPv2 Slot4 host -> Slot3 GPv2 Replacing slot id is necessary to run commands on GPv2 through openbmc

gpv2_negative_cycle(timeout=1200, reboot_type=None)[source]¶

Check negative test to make sure GPv2 returns error

gpv2power(host, cycle_type, timeout=1200)[source]¶

executes the cycle tests for GPv2 switch slot. 12V-cycle, 12V-on and 12V-off are valid for GPv2 slot. other cycle types should be tested under negative testing with

not supported message.

log_util_all_options()[source]¶

Returns log-util output for host slot + GPv2 slot

log_util_gpv2()[source]¶

Executes and returns the log-util output on GPv2 switch slot

BMCLightningV2 Module¶

get_flash_temperature(output, temp_val)[source]¶

Get the output from the fbjbod sensor, check all the sensors and verify if the status of all is “ok”

verify_flash_availability()[source]¶

AVA card is a riser card which holds the nvme. To check if the AVA card is present it should provide sensor util with ok status or with its temperature. This method will check for AVA card and then fetch its slot number in order to map the nvme it is holding

12V cycles(12V-on/off/cycle) is not supported in tiogapass

get_critical_services()[source]¶

This method returns a list of services that are always expected to run on the openBMC Tiogapass System

get_flash_temperature(output, temp_val)[source]¶

This method will take the slot number reported by the AVA card, map it to its equivalent nvme and provide the temperature of the nvme. Each AVA card will have 4 slots, max of 4 nvme can be attached. At any time if the temperature of the nvme is greater then 75 deg celsius it is high threshold value

verify_flash_availability()[source]¶

AVA card is a riser card which holds the nvme. To check if the AVA card is present it should provide sensor util with ok status or with its temperature. This method will check for AVA card and then fetch its slot number in order to map the nvme it is holding

verify_flash_sensors(out)[source]¶

The ava sensors which shows ok status implies the ava is available on the server and in turn shows the nvme temp status as ok which ever shows NA would mean ava card is not available
